googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotes: Early voting for the presidential election begins 15 days before the election, although voters can request a ballot in-person starting 30 days before the election.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* All Colorado elections are held by mail.  
* You can still request a one-time absentee ballot if you will be away from home during a specific election.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You will need a Colorado driver's license or state ID to register to vote online.  If you don't have ID, you can register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Colorado driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
